I just haven't found a weapon of mass

right now I'm gonna alright guys we're
gonna do an out review here
the sophomore LP from tobacco maniac me
so tobacco isn't something you just
smoke guys it's also the solo project of
black moths super rainbow frontman to
bathroom and black moth super rainbow
has a pretty distinct sound really
crispy break be drums fuzzy synths
damaging distortion heavy reverb and
phaser fed vocoder vocals and there's a
BS mr track that you should check out in
2007/2008 tobacco introduced us to his
solo work with [ __ ] up friends with a
DVD release and the CD release and to be
honest the line between these two
projects is very gray very faded tough
to tell where one starts and the other
ends if they weren't labeled differently
it would be difficult to tell what's a
tobacco track and what's a black mouth
super rainbow track especially because
about 80 to 90% of the sounds that are
in black mouth super rainbow releases
show up on tobacco albums too but if I
had to lay my hand on a clear concise
difference between these two projects
I'd say the tobacco sports a much much
heavier hip-hop influence for sure
especially on their latest LP black
Mouth super rainbow sets their song
structures in a much poppier much more
accessible vein whereas this new tobacco
is a lot more adventurous a lot more
free-spirited slightly less immediate
and a little bit noisier too this is the
type of stuff that can really make your
head spin if you let it
lots of reverb on melodies that just
swirl them into puddles of color and
very very intentionally damaged
production that brings a hundred
different kinds of Lofa sounds into the
mix but don't get me wrong some sounds
on the self here lo-fi summer HiFi could
be a melody could be a bead something's
gonna sound torn but there's also going
to be something that sounds part of the
way decent to give this track some kind
of dynamic no matter what direction
sonically or melodically each song goes
in at least there's a pretty phat beat
anchoring things down and keeping things
sensible a lot like on this track sweat
mother these are basically some really
creepy spooky danceable electronics that
would make the perfect soundtrack to
your next Halloween party or if you're
the type of person that has costume
parties in the summer invite me
hopefully there are a lot of first-time
listeners on this new tobacco album
because BEC yes the great Beck actually
lends his vocals on two tracks which is
pretty nice but among these 16 tracks ya
gets 16 bang for your buck among these
16 tracks there are some misses and some
tracks are so short it's kind of hard to
fall in love with them I was actually
kind of surprised to find out that the
Beck tracks were actually two of the
shortest some tracks just kind of come
off as rough ideas as opposed to
finished products but tobacco doesn't
really strike me as a project that puts
an emphasis on sprucing things up and
polishing things off if you're into the
black Mouth super rainbow sound if
you're into the tobacco sound this thing
is going to hit you with some pretty
considerable variation if you're outside
of that box a lot of these tracks may
come off sounding the same but I have to
say a lot of different colors here I
think this LP is a little bit more
ambitious than [ __ ] up friends has a
lot of the same sounds but is a little
less monotonous and maniac me hmm this
LP it really speaks to my dance music
bias I have a pretty strong dance music
bias arguably tobacco is doing what he's
always done but he's doing it better
than ever and that's how I'm pretty much
feeling on this LP I think my major
gripe is that this thing is so sonically
similar to that previous LP to black
Mouth super rainbow its kind
difficult to tell whether or not this
thing is actually gonna leave a lasting
impression on me or if it's just gonna
kind of fall into the gray area with the
other B SMR stuff the other tobacco
stuff I'm feeling a strong six to a
light seven on this LP if you're looking
for a change from tobacco a significant
change you're gonna be disappointed
however he still put together an album
that has funked the hell out of my
dancing shoes also I want to make a note
